sentences.sContent: “The bottom line question to ask is, Is your forgetfulness fundamentally interfering with how you function?
sentences.sContent_eng: “The bottom line question to ask is, Is your forgetfulness fundamentally interfering with how you function?
sentences.sCn: "要问的底线问题是,你的健忘是否真的根本性地妨碍了你的行动?"

sentences.sContent: Health experts say that stress can come with some pretty surprising symptoms—from forgetfulness to nausea to skin rashes.
sentences.sContent_eng: Health experts say that stress can come with some pretty surprising symptoms—from forgetfulness to nausea to skin rashes.
sentences.sCn: 健康专家们认为压力会伴随着许多令人惊讶的征兆而来——从健忘到恶心，甚至是皮疹。

sentences.sContent: “Most people when they turn 50 begin to look at forgetfulness with more seriousness, ” said Dr. Gene Cohen, the director of the Center for Aging, Health and Humanities at George Washington University.
sentences.sContent_eng: “Most people when they turn 50 begin to look at forgetfulness with more seriousness, ” said Dr. Gene Cohen, the director of the Center for Aging, Health and Humanities at George Washington University.
sentences.sCn: "大多数人们步入50岁后便开始严肃地看待健忘这个问题了,"乔治华盛顿大学人类老化,健康及人类研究中心的吉恩柯翰博士说.

words.tran: 健忘的；不注意的；疏忽的；使遗忘的
